related_questions.question: What is considered an affiliate company?
related_questions.snippet: The definition of “affiliated company” will vary, depending on the context in which the term is used. One way that companies are considered affiliated is when one company owns less than the majority interest in another company. Companies also may be affiliated when they are subsidiaries of a third company.
related_questions.title: Affiliated company dictionary definition | affiliated company defined

related_questions.question: What is an affiliate vs subsidiary company?
related_questions.snippet: A subsidiary is a company whose parent is a majority shareholder that owns more than 50% of all shares. For corporate, securities and capital markets, an affiliate is a person or entity directly or indirectly controlling, being controlled by, or under common control with another person or entity.Apr 14, 2019
related_questions.title: Subsidiary vs. Affiliate: What's the Difference? - Investopedia

related_questions.question: Are sister companies affiliates?
related_questions.snippet: In fact, in some cases, sister companies may compete against one another in the same market. “Affiliates” and “subsidiaries” are both measurements of ownership that a parent company has in other companies. An affiliate has only a minority share of its stock controlled by the parent company.

related_questions.question: What does it mean to be a subsidiary of a company?
related_questions.snippet: A subsidiary, subsidiary company or daughter company is a company that is owned or controlled by another company, which is called the parent company, parent, or holding company. The subsidiary can be a company, corporation, or limited liability company. In some cases it is a government or state-owned enterprise.
related_questions.title: Subsidiary - Wikipedia

answer_box.title: Affiliated Company - Morningstar
answer_box.snippet: Two companies are affiliated when one company owns less than a majority of the voting stock of the other, usually less than 50%, or when both are subsidiaries of a third corporation. A subsidiary is a company where more than 50% of the voting shares are owned by another corporation, called the parent company.

organic_results.title: Affiliate (commerce) - Wikipedia
organic_results.snippet: The term affiliate is used to describe the relationship between two entities wherein one owns less than a majority stake in the other's stock. Affiliations can also describe a type of relationship in which at least two different companies are subsidiaries of a larger parent company.
